original: Böös, Ernst Georg, lektor, Göteborg, f. 22/2/82 i Ö. Vingåker, Södermani. 1., av godsförvalt. Rudolf B. o. Helene Mertens. G. 11 m. Olga Christiansen. Barn: Ingrid f. 13, Thorsten 17. — Stud:ex. i Lund 01, farm. kand. 05, fiil. mag. 10, fil. lic. 16, fdl. dr 17, prov-år 12. Res. f. havsbiol. stud. v. Kri-stinebergs zool. stat. 07, f. vet:skapl. arb. v. Lunds botan. inst. 17-22. Vik. lektor i Halmstad 10, vik. adj. v. Gbgs real 10-11, v. Gbgs folksk :sem. 11, adj. i Lidköp. 12, v. Gbgs real 16, lektor i ’biol. m. hälsodära v. Gbgs latin sed. 21. Skr.: über Parthenogen. in d. Gruppe Aphanes d. Gattung Alche-milla nebst einigen im Zusammenh. damit steh. Fragen (17), Der experim. Nachweis d. Parthenog. in d. Gruppe Aphanes d. Gattung Alchemilla (20), über d. Natur einer gewiss. Blütena-nomalie b. Ranunculus acris (20), Neue embryoil. Stud. über Alchemilla arv. (24), rec. o. tidn:art., lärob. m. m. RNO.
translated: Böös, Ernst Georg, a teacher in Gothenburg, born on February 22, 1882 in Östra Vingåker, Södermanland, the first child of estate manager Rudolf B. and Helene Mertens. He married Olga Christiansen in 1911 and they had two children: Ingrid born in 1913 and Thorsten born in 1917. He graduated from Lund University with a degree in pharmacy in 1905 and earned a Bachelor of Arts in 1910, a Master of Philosophy in 1916, a Doctorate in Philosophy in 1917, and a teaching certificate in 1921. He conducted research on marine biology at the Kristineberg Zoological Station in 1907 and worked at the Botanical Institute at Lund from 1917-1922. He worked as a substitute teacher in Halmstad in 1910, at Gothenburg Realgymnasium from 1910-1911, at Gothenburg Folkskoleseminarium in 1911, as a teacher in Lidköping in 1912, and at Gothenburg Realgymnasium again in 1916. He became a biology teacher with a specialization in health science at Gothenburg Latin School in 1921. He wrote about parthenogenesis in the Aphanes genus of the Alchemilla plant, as well as other botanical topics, and was awarded the Royal Order of the North Star (RNO).

structured.name: Ernst Georg Böös

award.name: Royal Order of the North Star

structured.description: Ernst Georg Böös was a lecturer at Gothenburg Latin School, known for his research on parthenogenesis in the Aphanes genus of the Alchemilla plant. He was born on February 22, 1882 in Östra Vingåker, Södermanland, Sweden, the first child of estate manager Rudolf B. and Helene Mertens. He married Olga Christiansen in 1911 and they had two children, Ingrid and Thorsten. Böös graduated from Lund University with a degree in pharmacy in 1905, a Bachelor of Arts in 1910, a Master of Philosophy in 1916, a Doctorate in Philosophy in 1917 and a teaching certificate in 1921. He conducted research on marine biology at the Kristineberg Zoological Station in 1907 and worked at the Botanical Institute at Lund from 1917-1922. He worked as a substitute teacher in Halmstad in 1910, at Gothenburg Realgymnasium from 1910-1911, at Gothenburg Folkskoleseminarium in 1911, as a teacher in Lidköping in 1912, and at Gothenburg Realgymnasium again in 1916. He became a biology teacher with a specialization in health science at Gothenburg Latin School in 1921.
